name: Modafinil (Provigil)
summary: A wakefulness-promoting medication used for narcolepsy, obstructive sleep apnea, and shift work sleep disorder; sometimes used off-label for cognitive enhancement and fatigue.
description: Modafinil is a non-amphetamine central nervous system stimulant that promotes wakefulness. Its precise mechanism is not fully understood but is thought to involve inhibition of dopamine reuptake, modulation of orexin, histamine, and other neurotransmitter systems. It has lower abuse potential compared to traditional stimulants and is generally well tolerated.

sections.text: Exact mechanism unknown; thought to inhibit dopamine reuptake via dopamine transporter blockade, increase hypothalamic histamine release, and activate orexin neurons.

adult.narcolepsy_osA: 200 mg once daily in the morning
adult.shift_work: 200 mg taken approximately 1 hour before start of work shift

sections.text: Onset within 30–60 minutes; duration of wakefulness-promoting effect approximately 12–15 hours.
